summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021, forwarding a 2018 email thread about technical IP address submittals for equipment. The correspondence involves a Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal and a Communication Technician, discussing network configuration needs. The document header indicates it is part of the Epstein case files from the US Department of Justice, MCC-New York.

persons.name: Program Manager FBOP Contracts
persons.role: Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal
persons.context: The sender/recipient of emails in the chain, discussing technical IP address requirements for devices. The name appears to be a title/role rather than a specific individual's name.

persons.name: Communication Technician
persons.context: Recipient of an email asking how many ports are needed with IP addresses for device configuration.

connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding technical IP address and port requirements for device configuration.

events.title: Email exchange on IP submittals
events.description: Email correspondence between a Program Manager and a Communication Technician discussing the number of IP addresses and ports needed for devices.

events.title: Forwarding of 2018 email chain
events.description: An email from October 2021 forwards the November 2018 email thread about IP submittals.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from 2021 forwarding a 2018 technical discussion about IP address configurations for devices.
The correspondence involves a Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies (d.b.a. Convergint Federal) and a Communication Technician.
The document header indicates it is part of the Epstein case files from the US Department of Justice, MCC-New York.
The content is purely technical/administrative regarding network equipment setup, with no direct mention of Epstein, victims, or illegal activities.
The document's inclusion in the Epstein case files suggests it may be related to evidence gathering or investigation of communications or technical systems.
